column5: Thats my hand warmer these days. Toasty nuts,sorta speak.LOL
Thanks for the update Brian    Cool video.... real nice area you guys cover  Better luck next time out..... guess you'll be going with plan B from now on Leechman

With the deep heavy snow,there will  be no problem with going with plan B. Long drag from where we were today for one guy. As for the area,I showed Remo where they like to walk,yep right in the thick cover. Where he was sitting, it has a nice clear area among it .Longest shot being 30 yards. They like that cover.
Just a matter of time Brian.... one of them will make a mistake at some point and come out of cover    just got to be there when it does

Well I sent out this invite and sure enough, he,s heading up in the AM. I got a good laugh at his question. Havent you got yer deer yet???????????????????? I said,When you going to shoot yer first turkey????????????? Wayne Im sure you know who it is.LMAO Talk about a kid in a candy shop.  Wish us luck. Im going to need it.  POWER OF THE OFC.   BTW,he,ll be siiting close to the dogs.HAHAHAHAH
LMAO... say hello to Remo for me bud !!  Saw three does in the yard yesterday... lmao !  20 Turkeys in the front yard in front of the dining room window EVERY day! lol
Happy huntin' boyz!
Good luck Brian     Don't know to story behind this but eventually will all find out Leechman
We just need to see 1,hope he has is eyes open. He,s got a busy night.LOL
Maybe I need to remind him of what they look like...  REMO...  Deer..    Turkey...
LMAO Wayne..... great shots Quite the gathering you have there

The best part about this hunt is,It will be about sharing,a bond,sharing our sport and having spent time as friends/sportsmen.If a kill happens,well thats a bonus. Now Remo,get to bed earlly,I need yer eyes keen and sharp,as I,ll be taking a nap.LOL Dont forget.Exit Essa rd,go through the lights,and park. I,ll be there(just like the song) HAHHAHAHAHA  Oh that didnt sound good did it?????????????????LOL
You'all be careful down in the woods with this lad Remo! Sounds like he's up ta sumptin... not that there's anything wrong with that....
Don't nap too much.... and hope you don't get scared the bejezzers out of ya

The only reason I haven't got my deer yet is because I haven't been out archery hunting except for an hour or so one evening. Saw a buck chasing 3 does across a field, but they were too far for a shot. Got his attention for a second, but he had other things on his mind. No worries Brian. If one of those wild mutts takes a snap at me, I'll teach him a lesson if front of all his buddies. (see signature)  If all goes well, you'll have fresh meat in the freezer. I'm just not sure what species it will be.  See you in the am.   Saw three does in the yard yesterday... lmao !  You just had to rub it in didn't you Wayne.   Gotta go. Taking the little guy to an OHL game at the Hershey Centre. Mississauga (St. Mikes Majors) vs. Erie Otters  cheers
Best of luck to you both    Looking forward to your report
Something tells me, he,ll be home early. Otters will be doing the major chew, on the Majors tonight.
Wayne,why you got to  punish the guy???????????

Got home about 11:15pm. My son wanted to do a bit of skating after the game. Erie was ahead 4 - 1 most of the game, but we managed a couple of late goals to make it close. 4-3 final. Good call Brian.  Just got my gear ready & now I'm typing rather than sleeping. Gotta get some shut eye. Brian will probably be sleeping in the stand and the deer will walk right by him. Somebody has to be awake to do the shooting.  cheers.
best of luck to you guys! hopefully we will see some pics of your great success or at least some nice scenery pics!   Hawk
Hope to see some pics tomorrow!!

First off it was real nice to hook up with Remo. We shared some great stories on our drive to and from the bush. Super fella and family man. When we arrived at our spot,the dogs were yelpping like you would not believe. Tell,em Remo,they wont believe me.LOL We got ourselves all dressed up and off we head along that road I was talking to you about in my last post. Sure as poop,theres tracks all over,and fresh. Im starting to second guess myself as to weather we go to the stand or sit in the opening. The hell with it,lets just stick with the plan, and go to the stand. I get Remo to the first stand and head off to do some ground hunting. It was the perfect morning.Quiet and no wind to speak of. Once I got myself set up on my first spot,it didnt take long to hear a snap behind me. The heart starts and Im am afraid to even budge.It,s right behind me. I slowly turn,trying my best to see through the pines and yes there it is,a tan furry animal. I hold steady and still, waiting for it to make it,s next move. For some reason,it backs away,turns and walks off. Man this ground hunting is alot harder then one thinks. I know being down off the stand,they can catch your scent alot easier. I give the deer 10 minutes to be on it,s way before I decide to try and stalk it. I followed the tracks for about 20 minutes right out to the opening,and right under my afternoon stand.  With no sight of the deer I head off to the corn field to see if anything is out there. Nope,no deer nor turkeys,but I did watch them do thier fly downs.Love that.  Since Remo,s son had a hockey game at noon our day was being cut short,so I headed back to him around 10:30ish. On my travels to him I see some very fresh tracks. I was wondering if he got a view of the passer by,but nope,he was sleeping.LOL J/K.  We called it a morning and headed back out. Lots of good sign,just have to be there when they are.  Oh that plan B thing. Seeing all the fresh tracks heading in,I thought maybe we should just ground hunt the opening and see what happens,whyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy,because of this    The bloody deer walked our path in,right to the fence line. Oh I was so $%$%&%&%$. I,ll be siting there Sunday.  Well that was our morning,I know Remo had some action at the stand,but I,ll leave that for him to tell.  A vid(sorry for the clacking noice,dont know what causes it)  <embed width="448" height="361" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" src="http://img.photobucket.com/player.swf?file=http://vidmg.photobucket.com/albums/v731/misfish/pic02275.flv">  Remo in the stand.    Looking forward to hooking up again Bud.
Hope you guys made out better than i did this morning.  Saw about 100 turkeys!  But not a single deer this time around.
Buckster,I got this feeling that Sunday will be the day. Storms acoming so maybe they will be eating to hunker down for it.
I told my old man the same thing. Can't wait to freeze my nuggets off in the morning lol... Hope the big boy shows his face again
I find it REALLY hard to believe that Brian and Remo went hunting... let alone together.. and bagged NOTHING!
Incredible....  can't be true???  (Insert sarcasm here..)
Hey,it,s not my fault thier smarter then the average bear.
